Description: Green/blue glazed composition amulet in the form of a double-sided wedjat-eye, and pierced lengthwise; on one side at least, the upper edge has a plait design underlining the brow.
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but possibly from Tell Dafana, as suggested by the context of the item in the list, if not from Tell Nabasha or any other Eastern Delta site excavated by Petrie in 1886.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.45, p.59, p.60, p.180, pl.22)
